item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.M. Coetzee
item.description: "A book should be an axe to chop open the frozen sea inside us." -- J.M. Coetzee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.M. Coetzee
item.description: "I speak to the broken halves of all our selves and tell them to embrace, loving the worst in us equally with the best." -- J.M. Coetzee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Anna Gavalda
item.description: "it wouldn’t take much for the sorrow she felt at the sorrow she caused to drown her again" -- Anna Gavalda

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Anna Gavalda
item.description: "Clic Clac. Plus personne ne bouge. Moment suspendu. Bonheur." -- Anna Gavalda

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Alice Munro
item.description: "There is a limit to the amount of misery and disarray you will put up with, for love, just as there is a limit to the amount of mess you can stand around a house. You can't know the limit beforehand, but you will know when you've reached it. I believe this." -- Alice Munro

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Alice Munro
item.description: "A story is not like a road to follow … it's more like a house. You go inside and stay there for a while, wandering back and forth and settling where you like and discovering how the room and corridors relate to each other, how the world outside is altered by being viewed from these windows. And you, the visitor, the reader, are altered as well by being in this enclosed space, whether it is ample and easy or full of crooked turns, or sparsely or opulently furnished. You can go back again and again, and the house, the story, always contains more than you saw the last time. It also has a sturdy sense of itself of being built out of its own necessity, not just to shelter or beguile you." -- Alice Munro

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Alice Munro
item.description: "If I decided to send this to you, where would I send it? When I think of writing the whole address on the envelope I am paralyzed. It's too painful to think of you in the same place with your life going on in the same way, minus me. And to think of you not there, you somewhere else but I don't know where that is, is worse." -- Alice Munro

item.title: Rachel add a quote by A. L. Kennedy
item.description: "You can look at the words on this paper and, because they are the ones I am used to choosing, they will show you the shape of me. I am here to be read in the way you might read the impression of my weight in a bed after a still night, a restless night, a night not alone." -- A. L. Kennedy

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Alice Munro
item.description: "What she felt was a lighthearted sort of compassion, almost like laughter. A swish of tender hilarity, getting the better of all her sores and hollows, for the time given." -- Alice Munro

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Junot Diaz
item.description: "That’s life for you. All the happiness you gather to yourself, it will sweep away like it’s nothing. If you ask me I don’t think there are any such things as curses. I think there is only life. That’s enough." -- Junot Diaz

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Junot Diaz
item.description: "It's never the changes we want that change everything." -- Junot Diaz

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Leah Price
item.description: "But most of all books (I say again and again) are like the Thirty-Mile Woman from Toni Morrison's Beloved: 'She is a friend of my mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order.' ~ Junot Diaz, author of the Pulitzer Prize novel The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao." -- Leah Price

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "Sweet, crazy conversations full of half sentences, daydreams and misunderstandings more thrilling than understanding could ever be." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Rachel add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "Books don't offer real escape, but they can stop a mind scratching itself raw." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Rachel add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "A half-read book is a half-finished love affair." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Nothing can dim the light which shines from within." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Each person deserves a day away in which no problems are confronted, no solutions searched for." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "A woman who is convinced that she deserves to accept only the best challenges herself to give the best. Then she is living phenomenally." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "In all the world, there is no heart for me like yours. In all the world, there is no love for you like mine." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Poetry puts starch in your backbone so you can stand, so you can compose your life." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.M. Coetzee
item.description: "Truth is not spoken in anger. Truth is spoken, if it ever comes to be spoken, in love. The gaze of love is not deluded. It sees what is best in the beloved even when what is best in the beloved finds it hard to emerge into the light." -- J.M. Coetzee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.M. Coetzee
item.description: "The secret of happiness is not doing what we like but in liking what we do." -- J.M. Coetzee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.M. Coetzee
item.description: "(I)f we are going to be kind, let it be out of simple generosity, not because we fear guilt or retribution." -- J.M. Coetzee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.M. Coetzee
item.description: "...So that someone might want to put you in a book...So that you may be worth putting in a book...Live like a hero...Be a main character. Otherwise, what is life for?" -- J.M. Coetzee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.M. Coetzee
item.description: "I urge you: don't cut short these thought-trains of yours. Follow them through to their end. Your thoughts and your feelings. Follow them through and you will grow with them." -- J.M. Coetzee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.M. Coetzee
item.description: "Was it serious? I don't know. It certainly had serious consequences." -- J.M. Coetzee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.M. Coetzee
item.description: "... but what do slow and fast matter any more?" -- J.M. Coetzee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.M. Coetzee
item.description:
"The truth is, he tired of criticism, tired of prose measured by the yard."
--Disgrace" -- J.M. Coetzee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.M. Coetzee
item.description: "We must cultivate, all of us, a certain ignorance, a certain blindness, or society will not be tolerable." -- J.M. Coetzee

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen
